instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
L9004 was burnt out. pad was gone. run jumper <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR>

now getting 3.28v on pin 2/3/4
also got 12.6v on 21/22

chime screen flashes white for like  a split second. external has display.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: If it flashes white for one second then goes out, is there image with no backlight or just no image period?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: the backlight is still present but NO image.

threads.message: Backlight cannot be present with 12.6V on the backlight pins. Please confirm...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 33793"]Backlight cannot be present with 12.6V on the backlight pins. Please confirm...[/QUOTE]

definately something there as its not 100% pitch black. its strange it turns on chimes white screen flash. then its just black.

EDIT: you right- 12.6v when sleeping but when boot and running 25.6v?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: If the screen is white then goes dark instantly, that sounds like an <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> problem. Honestly post video of what it does that might help

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: i checked the components on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> resistor is reading like 97.8k and <TRANSISTOR>Q5701</TRANSISTOR> looks fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image

threads.message: Diode mode on all 6 LVDS lines (pins 8-18)?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: duke most are reading ~497 with the exception of pin 18 which is 0 i turn over to the over side and one of the probe points which connect to L9080 is completely corroded. could this be the issue? should i run a jumper from pin 18 to L9080?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
All good it works now jumper worked great.

I cant believe i overlooked a probe point.
